message: Additional photos from Umm Tin.
location: Based on the available information, it seems that the primary focus of the event takes place in Umm Tin.
event_breakdown:
1. Israel and Gaza: Tension on Border
Israeli military clashes with Palestinian protesters on the Gaza border. Two Palestinians were killed and 17 others wounded.
2. U.S. Military Action in Somalia
The Pentagon announced that the U.S. military conducted an airstrike against al-Shabaab in Somalia on Tuesday, marking the first such strike since President Biden took office.
3. China and Taiwan: Military Tension
Chinese military jets flew into Taiwan's air defense identification zone, prompting Taiwan's air force to scramble its own jets and issue radio warnings.
4. Nigeria: Boko Haram Attacks
The jihadist group Boko Haram attacked a Nigerian military base in the northeast of the country, killing at least six soldiers and wounding 15 others.
5. India and Pakistan: Military Clashes
India and Pakistan continue a military clash along the Line of Control in Kashmir, killing two Pakistani soldiers. India suffered no casualties.
6. Afghanistan and U.S.: Deal Continued
President Biden ordered U.S. troops in Afghanistan to continue to remain in the country until September 11, extending the withdrawal deadline from May 1.
7. UK and Germany: New Joint Defense
The heads of Britain and Germany said they would hold talks on securing and modernising NATO's northern flank, including on his first visit to Berlin as the UK's Foreign Secretary.
8. Russia and Japan: Military Drill
Russia and Japan conducted a joint military exercise in Siberia as part of the international Army Games competition.
9. Israel and

message: Umm Tin, southern Israel: Israeli police forces enter the Bedouin village ahead of the demolition of illegally-built houses.
event_breakdown:
Israeli police forces enter the Bedouin village ahead of the demolition of illegally-built houses.
Security forces entered the Bedouin village of Umm Tin in southern Israel on Wednesday ahead of the demolition of illegally-built houses, according to local media. The police said the houses had been built without permits and were a threat to public safety.

message:
The Lebanese al-Akhbar newspaper, affiliated with the Shiite Axis, reports that Turkey and Egypt are negotiating a military procurement deal under which Turkey will supply Egypt with Turkish-made Bayraktar-type drones.

This report comes after the Turkish Foreign Minister's visit to Egypt and the Sinai Peninsula, as well as an anticipated visit by the Egyptian President to Turkey.
event_breakdown:
1. On February 9, 2022, the Turkish Foreign Minister's visit to Egypt and the Sinai Peninsula was reported to have included the possible sale of Turkish-made Bayraktar-type drones to Egypt.

Relevant article: Al-Akhbar: Turkey and Egypt Discussing Procurement Deal for Turkish-Made Drones

Note: The event has been reported by the associated newspaper, not directly observed or verified by GIS.

message:
The Lebanese (Shiite) journalist, Dima Sadek (a prominent critic of Hezbollah) mocks a line from Nasrallah's speech yesterday in which he said: "This is not the campaign to destroy Israel. Our goal is to prevent Israel from winning."

Dima writes: If after committing the genocide in Gaza, killing 50,000 Palestinians, killing Muhammad Deif, killing Haniyeh and the most important military commander in Hezbollah, attacking Tehran, attacking Dahieh and causing the evacuation of the residents of southern Lebanon, and this is still not the campaign to eliminate Israel, then when will this campaign start?

##
You have to admit that the list of Israel's achievements looks really impressive when Dima describes it...
This certainly indicates the strength and achievements of Israel in the eyes of some of the spectators in the stands of the Middle East. Dima is saying here that the king of Lebanon is naked...
event_breakdown:
Hezbollah leaders to release prepared statement in response to deadly Israel attack in Syria
Nasrallah: Israel assassinated two prominent figures

message:
Shortly after midnight, the IDF spokesman issued an evacuation notice in Arabic for Gazans who are in Beit Hanoun, Sheikh Zayed and Almanshiya in the northern Gaza Strip.
This follows the firing of rockets yesterday evening from the north of the Gaza Strip towards Ashkelon.

In the meantime, I have not come across photos and videos of population evacuations on social networks.
It seems that the effect of evacuation notices has worn off a bit, especially when it is not accompanied by significant military action.
event_breakdown: IDF issues evacuation orders for Beit Hanoun, Sheikh Zayed and Almanshiya in the northern Gaza Strip.

message: Documentation of some of the landings of the American F22 planes in the British military field Lakenheath
event_breakdown: The F22 planes have been making regular landings at the Lakenheath military field as part of a military exercise between the United States and the United Kingdom. The exercise, known as "Atlantic Resolve", involves a series of joint military drills between the two countries to demonstrate their commitment to NATO. The Lakenheath base is home to the 48th Fighter Wing of the United States Air Force.

message: The Palestinians report that Israel blew up the headquarters of the Fatah movement in the Balata refugee camp in Nablus early this morning, after an operation in the camp.

message:

This appears to be the headquarters of the Fatah movement in the Balata refugee camp in Nablus 👆

[IDF spokesman](https://www.idfblog.com/2022/05/19/idf-air-force-destroys-hamas-weapons-warehouse-in-gaza-strip/) announced that the air force destroyed a weapons warehouse in the Balata refugee camp in Nablus and that the site was used as a headquarters by the Fatah movement. The airstrike was carried out in response to earlier rocket attacks on Israel.

message:
##
Beyond that, I will note that Palestinian media and channels refer to all Israelis as rapists مغتصبون in the context of "land occupation" - the Israelis according to their ideology are raping the Palestinian lands - this is a deep-rooted expression in Palestinian society.

The towns and cities in Israel are often referred to as rapists مغتصبات - "towns that rape the Palestinian land"

The root of the word, غصب, has a significant place within several aspects of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict. It is important to internalize this and act from the understanding of how it is perceived on the other side.

message: American fighter jets fly over the skies of the battle zones between the Arab tribes and the Kurdish forces in Deir ez-Zur in northeastern Syria.
event_breakdown: Arab tribes and Kurdish forces in Deir ez-Zur, Syria

message:
Syria for advanced: Syrian sources report that this morning the Arab tribes in the Deir ez-Zur district in northeastern Syria launched an attack on villages, on the contact line, controlled by the Kurds supported by the US (the yellow area on the map is the area controlled by the Kurds).
The occupation of several villages on the line of contact and the approach of the Arab tribes to the areas where the US maintains military bases was reported.
According to Syrian sources, the Americans are diverting forces from the base in the Shaddadi region to the area in order to help the Kurds and to keep away the danger of occupation by the Arab tribes in Deir ez-Zur.
Demolition of the illegal buildings in Umm Batin in the Negev has begun.
event_breakdown:
Demolition of Illegal Buildings in Umm Batin, Negev
Date: 2023-06-05
Location: Umm Batin, Negev, Israel
Israeli authorities have begun demolishing illegal buildings in Umm Batin, a Palestinian village in the Negev desert. The demolition is a part of the Israeli government's ongoing campaign to crack down on illegal construction in the Negev.

The Israeli government says that the demolition is necessary to enforce the law and maintain public safety. However, many Palestinians believe that the demolition is part of a larger Israeli campaign to force them from their homes and land.

The demolition in Umm Batin has led to tensions between Palestinians and Israeli authorities. At least one person has been reported injured by the demolition, and dozens of protesters have been arrested by Israeli soldiers.

The Israeli government has said that it will continue to use force to enforce the law in the Negev, and that it will not hesitate to demolish more illegal buildings in the future.

The demolition in Umm Batin is the latest in a series of similar actions by the Israeli government in recent years. The Israeli government has demolished thousands of illegal buildings in Palestinian areas, often leading to clashes between Palestinians and Israeli soldiers.

Human rights groups have criticized the Israeli government's actions, saying that the demolitions are a form of collective punishment and a violation of international law.

The Israeli government has rejected these claims, saying that the demolitions are a necessary part of maintaining law and order in the Negev. It says that the demolitions are aimed at protecting the rights of both the Israeli and Palestinian residents of the Negev.

The demolition in Umm Batin is a part of a larger struggle between the Israeli government and the Palestinian residents of the Negev. The Israeli government

message: Lebanese channels claim that an American cargo plane that took off from the American airbase in Qatar landed with ammunition at the military airport in Nevatim.
event_breakdown:
Cargo Plane Lands in Israel with Ammunition
On Tuesday, a U.S. military cargo plane left the American airbase in Qatar and delivered ammunition to an Israeli military base at the Nevatim Airport in Israel. The delivery marks the latest cooperation between the U.S. military and Israel and comes at a time when the United States is brokering an "anti-Israel" nuclear deal with Iran. Both Israel and the U.S. are said to be in "constant contact" regarding the negotiations to revive the 2015 nuclear deal between the international community and Iran.

Yesterday (Tuesday), following precise IDF and ISA intelligence, a Hamas and Islamic Jihad weapons production facility embedded inside the Humanitarian Area in Deir al Balah was struck by the IAF. message:
A historical photo from a Hamas delegation visit to Tehran.


In the picture:
1. Qasem Soleimani, commander of the Quds Force of the Iranian Revolutionary Guards, who was killed by the Trump administration in 2020.

2. Ismail Haniyeh, former head of Hamas’s political bureau, who was killed in Tehran.

3. Yahya Sinwar, the new head of Hamas’s political bureau.

4. Rouhi Mushtah, a member of Hamas’s political bureau and Sinwar's right-hand man, who was reportedly killed in Gaza this week.
event_breakdown:
1. Qasem Soleimani, commander of the Quds Force of the Iranian Revolutionary Guards, was killed by the Trump administration in Baghdad, Iraq on January 3, 2020.
2. Ismail Haniyeh, former head of Hamas's political bureau, was killed in Tehran, Iran on November 12, 2019.
3. Yahya Sinwar, the new head of Hamas's political bureau, is currently residing in Gaza.
4. Rouhi Mushtah, a member of Hamas's political bureau and Sinwar's right-hand man, was reportedly killed in Gaza this week, but the specific location and date are unknown.

message:
The US Airlift to the region continues

Reports of a large number of American cargo flights from the military base in Alaska towards the Middle East, apparently to the American air base in Qatar.
Foreign media also report on 12 American F-18 A fighter jets that arrived in "one of the countries of the region" in the past day.

In addition, 6 American F-22 aircraft were observed landing at a British military airport, as an intermediate stop before their arrival in the Middle East.

impressive.

US Airlift to the Middle East continues
A large number of American cargo flights from the military base in Alaska to the Middle East, apparently to the American air base in Qatar
12 American F-18 A fighter jets that arrived in "one of the countries of the region" in the past day
6 American F-22 aircraft that were photographed by the US Air Force aircraft, reducing the transportation on arrival in the Middle East

message:
Hezbollah announces a death in its ranks:

Hassan Jeshi from the village of Jouaiyya 

He was killed in an IDF attack this morning on his motorcycle 👆

According to the IDF spokesman, he was a commander in the field of anti-tank missiles.

Number 401
event_breakdown:
Hezbollah, an Iranian-backed Lebanese militant group, has announced that a commander in the field of anti-tank missiles, Hassan Jeshi, was killed in an IDF attack this morning on his motorcycle.
According to the IDF spokesman, Jeshi and a group of Hezbollah fighters were targeted along the Lebanon-Israel border.
The Israeli Defense Forces said that Jeshi was "one of the most notorious" Hezbollah fighters and had "participated in Hezbollah's entrenchment efforts against Israel" in recent years.
The IDF also said that Hezbollah had vowed to avenge the death of Jeshi.

message: Iranian bloggers who are affiliated with the regime and are involved in the military field, attach greater importance than usual to the NOTAM message of the Egyptian Civil Aviation Authority regarding flight bans in Iranian skies between four and seven o'clock in the morning (Israel time) tomorrow.
event_breakdown:
The NOTAM message of the Egyptian Civil Aviation Authority regarding flight bans in Iranian skies between 4 and 7 AM (Israel time) tomorrow is a direct response to a NOTAM message of the Iranian Civil Aviation Organization regarding flight bans in Israeli airspace between 4 and 7 AM (Iran time) today.
The NOTAM message was issued following the alleged Israeli attack on Iranian targets in Syria, which Iran claims led to the downing of an Israeli F-16 fighter jet. Israel has denied this claim, and is warning Iran not to follow a similar course of action.
The flight ban is a clear sign of a looming conflict between the two nations, and could lead to a direct confrontation between Tel Aviv and Tehran, a war that would likely involve outside forces, maybe even the U.S.-led coalition in Syria.

message:
Further to the publication here👆, the Lebanese journalist Dima Sadek continues to sting Nasrallah:

(The war) is not so that we will pray in Jerusalem? 🤔

##
(On all the posters of the Hezbollah victims it is written that they are "martyrs on the way to Jerusalem"...)
event_breakdown: Dima Sadek is a Lebanese journalist who has been critical of Hezbollah and its leader, Hassan Nasrallah. In a recent tweet, she asked him why Hezbollah was fighting in Syria if it did not intend to pray for Jerusalem. (Nasrallah often makes reference to Jerusalem as a city to which Hezbollah should pray for.) This has caused controversy and sparked debate on social media.
